alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Catawba; Cleveland; Davie; Gaston; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell; Greater Rutherford; Iredell; Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 6:22AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catawba, eastern Rutherford, northwestern Davie, Alexander, Lincoln, Iredell, southeastern Caldwell, Cleveland, western Gaston and southeastern Burke Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 621 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Boomer to 9 miles west of Hickory to 9 miles northeast of Forest City. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Statesville, Shelby, Newton, Lincolnton, Forest City, Taylorsville, Gastonia, Kings Mountain and St. Stephens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Alexander; Catawba; Cleveland; Davie; Gaston; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell; Greater Rutherford; Iredell; Lincoln
